Point location in a volume


Functions

GtvCell * gtv_point_locate_slow (GtsPoint *p, GtvVolume *volume, GtvCell *guess)
GtvCell * gtv_point_locate (GtsPoint *p, GtvVolume *volume, GtvCell *guess)

Function Documentation

GtvCell* gtv_point_locate ( GtsPoint *  p,
GtvVolume *  volume,
GtvCell *  guess 
)

Locate a point in a triangulation using a remembering stochastic walk (Olivier Devillers, Sylvain Pion and Monique Teillaud, 2002, `Walking in a triangulation', International Journal of Foundations in Computer Science, 13:181--199). Note that at present this will not work for volumes with holes in their interior.

Parameters:
p a GtsPoint to locate;
volume a GtvVolume;
guess a GtvCell which is an initial guess for a cell containing p or NULL.
Returns:
a GtvCell containing p or NULL if p is not in volume.

GtvCell* gtv_point_locate_slow ( GtsPoint *  p,
GtvVolume *  volume,
GtvCell *  guess 
)

Find a GtvCell in a given volume which encloses a GtsPoint by sequentially testing the cells. This is not a very good way of locating a point but it does work and can be used in testing other point location methods.

Parameters:
p a GtsPoint;
volume a GtvVolume to search for the location of p;
guess ignored, included for compatibility with other location functions.
Returns:
a GtvCell containing p or NULL if p is not in v.
